titleInfo.title: Letter from R.L. Boyd to \Col. Hicks\

mods.note: Madisonville, Tenn.June 26, 1925. Dear Col. Hicks,I took an active part in the passage of the anti-evolution bill. I am still interested. The Methodist preacher here at Mad- and myself are planing to come over to Dayton on July 10th - start from here early on the morning of the 10th - to be at the \monkey trial.\ At what hour will the trial begin? Can you arrange for us to have a seat up right close to the \show\? I want to see the \monkey\. I wish I was a lawyer and could heave 30 min. to skin those decendents of the beasts of the forest. God's children cannot be dabsed with the brute around where I stay. Please write me,Yours,R.L. Boyd
